pros: Friendly coworkers, plenty of opportunities to learn, very chill

cons: I am not getting enough part-time hours, which I need for supporting the tuition for my College education.

pros: Super friendly and understanding staff, but plans tend to change in the organization over and over again. A little bit of stiffness between staff who work at home or at the organization. Overall, they do great work. Benefits are great.
cons: Some staff tension, disorganization, and things at the organization change often.

review_title: It really is who you know...

cons: There is a huge diversity of white men employed there.  Only a few YOUNG women so far.  Not many black/brown faces.

Really nice concept for a non-profit with great people.
Handle a lot of computer hardware and lots of opportunities to interact with volunteers.

cons: Laidback, almost disorganized at times. No set roles or responsibilities,  more of just showing up and finding something to do.
